general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed the new commissioner, Shant Shahakarian, and requested him to introduce himself and his interest in sustainability.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Shahakarian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Introduced himself as a former engineer and current attorney in intellectual property with experience in alternative fuels and sustainable technologies, and mentioned he is a Glendale resident for over 10 years and is excited to help the city move forward with its sustainability goals, and create a place with clean air and clean water.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed Commissioner Shahakarian.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the process for a comment letter that former Commissioner Alec wanted to submit at a prior meeting to the council or Transportation Commission and clarified that it needs to be agendized.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Requested to agendize a letter about community outreach that the commission could do, including a speaker series and field trips. She referenced a previous city sponsored tour of businesses in Glendale and suggested offering trips to major infrastructure with sustainability components like power plants or landfills.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Asked for clarification on whether the letter suggests the commission take a stance on outreach efforts.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed this and stated it would need to be coordinated with Three David’s office and that interested members would participate.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Stated they would determine if commission from the City Council is required to proceed with outreach and bring a recommendation to the next meeting.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Seconded agendizing the letter.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Commented that the State of California officially banned styrofoam or expanded polystyrene (EPS) food ware, even though SB 54 has been kicked back, so there should not be any stores selling the items in Glendale.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired when the polystyrene foodware ban took effect.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed that the ban went into effect statewide.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Explained EPS to mean expanded polystyrene, or foam, food ware.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Shared that the prom-themed clothing swap would be held at the Glendale Central Library Teen Center in about two weeks and is promoted through social media.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated that the Earth Day Fair would be discussed further in a later agenda item and this was another project that has now passed.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Requested the student commissioners to share more about the clothing swap.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated that it will center on a teen audience to promote sustainable practices in an accessible way. The clothing swap will allow people to look for prom dresses and not spend too much money by coming to the library.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired whether the clothing swap is an appropriate venue to promote against fast fashion, where manufactured fashion lasts a little under a year before being tossed.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Explained that part of the clothing swap is education against fast fashion, to have a different channel subscribing to it, so it allows the student to have a different channel that wasn't subscribing to fast fashion.  During the same event, there will be a tailor, a photobooth with prom themes, a makeup artist for consultations, and goody bags donated by businesses.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Stated that this was very impressive.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Concluded this item by remarking on headwinds in sustainability and commended commissioners and staff for their work.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Wished former Sustainability Commissioner Alec Bartsasof good luck on the Transportation Commission and appreciated his expertise while he served and acknowledged his four years on the commission.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed the hope that Alec would return to speak as needed, because his input is valued.

agenda_items.title: One C. Report Regarding Posting of the Agenda. The agenda for the May 1, 2025 meeting of the Sustainability Commission was posted April 25, 2025, on the bulletin board outside City Hall.
agenda_items.summary: The agenda for the meeting was posted on April 25, 2025 on the bulletin board outside City Hall.

agenda_items.title: Approval of Minutes. 2. A. Approval of the Minutes of the Commission Regular Meeting held February 6, 2025.
agenda_items.summary: The minutes from the February 6, 2025, meeting were up for approval.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Moved to approve the minutes.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Seconded.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked if commissioners reviewed the minutes or watched the recording of the meeting.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Shahakarian
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed that he had reviewed the minutes and approved them.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired if Commissioner Shahakarian watched the tape of the meeting.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Shahakarian
commissioner_comments.comment: Had not watched the tape.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Recommended that Commissioner Shahakarian abstain from voting.

agenda_items.title: Board Member/Staff Comments.
agenda_items.summary: Open for board members and staff to make any comments or share information.

agenda_items.title: Oral Communications - Discussion is limited to items within the jurisdiction of the Sustainability Commission. Each speaker is allowed 5 minutes. Sustainability Commission members may question or respond to the speaker, but there will be no debate or decision. The matter may be referred to staff for investigation and report.
agenda_items.summary: Opportunity for public comment on topics within the commission's jurisdiction; each speaker limited to five minutes, with no debate or decisions made.

agenda_items.title: Action Items 5.A. Selection of Sustainability Commission Chairperson and Vice-Chairperson for the 2025-2026 Term. 1. Motion to elect the Chairperson of the Sustainability Commission. 2. Motion to elect the Vice-Chairperson of the Sustainability Commission.
agenda_items.summary: Annual selection of the chair and vice-chair for the commission, with a one-year term ending in March 2026.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated that Commissioner Kartunian was contacted about whether he would put himself forward for the chairperson position, but he did not respond.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Nominated herself as chair, referencing seniority and expressing that it was her turn to be chair, while referring to the Mayor selection.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked if they nominate the chair and vice chair at the same time or separately, and stated she would like to put herself out there when it is for Vice Chair.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated she had no nomination at this time.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated the process and roll call for the nominations.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Nominated herself as Vice Chair as well, while recognizing she has been around a while and has been a part of this before.

agenda_items.title: Action Items 5.B. Selection of Ex-Officio Recruitment Ad Hoc Committee. 1. Motion selecting one voting member and two ex-officio members of the Sustainability Commission to serve as an ad hoc student member selection committee to conduct the screening and selection of qualified candidates for interviews.
agenda_items.summary: The commission selects the ad hoc committee to undertake the selection and interviews of the candidates to serve for Ex-Officios for the 2025-2026 commission term.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned that staff has already begun advertising the positions on social media and at in-person events, and the application closes June 15th, with interviews completed by June 25th.  The recommendations of the candidates will be made to the full commission at the July 3rd commission meeting.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated that the Ex-Officios will be a part of the ad hoc committee and that they need one voting member to be on the ad hoc committee too. After a voting member has been identified, staff will set up interviews and everything.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired whether staff will be sending communications to the different schools since it had mixed results in the past.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed that staff will be sending information to all the schools and through as many outlets as possible.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Requested more information and for the members to confirm their interest in being the person on the committee, working with the ex-officios.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated she would be happy to serve.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated the process and called the roll.

agenda_items.title: Reports and Information 6.A. City of Glendale Sustainability Commission 2025-26 Work Plan.
agenda_items.summary: Staff will review the work plan that the commission had voted on earlier this year for a new commissioner and available for questions.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned that the commission has a number of focus areas for 2025: Outreach, Building systems, urban ecosystems, mobility and land use, and social and government systems. The commission has selected actions to push forward in different focus areas and extend the work of the commission.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Regarding outreach engagement, key projects are: the student learning engagement projects, working on earth day, continuing recruitment of ex-officio members, increasing direct public contact, working on collaborative community and city projects, and meeting with community members at public events. Regarding mobility and land use, the commission landed on supporting vision zero plans, focusing on reducing accidents within the city, and the expansion of EV charging infrastructure.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Regarding building systems, the commission landed on reviewing demand response programs, managed by GWP, reserve setbacks as fire separation, and bringing fire resistance to the forefront of new construction and remodels, promoting the use of non-combustible materials. Staff reached out to Firewise and US Green Building Council, fire teams, and hopes to have them present to the commission this year.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Regarding urban ecosystems, the commission landed on supporting expansion of green spaces and parks, prioritizing work in South Glendale, supporting the Lose the Lawn grass recycling campaign, reviewing green waste diversion programs, considering options for improving adherence to SP 1383, and reducing dependence on outside water resources. The Integrated Waste Management team is hoped to present at the August commission meeting on diversion programs and e-waste collection programs.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Regarding social and government systems, the commission landed on providing recommendations to City Council on state legislation. The legislative review consultants hopes to present at the September commission meeting, review the waste audits to determine if the city's programs, ordinances are addressing elements of prominent elements of waste stream at the August meeting, review progress of adopted cap measures and actions, assess the effectiveness of cooling centers and other heat resilience measures for residents and vulnerable populations, and evaluate the effectiveness of fire evacuation resources.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated a lot of time has passed and the goal of the meeting is to just review what was previously decided on.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned that all of them are available to answer any questions regarding this plan.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged that he will bring the topic up again at the June commission meeting and asked is there interest being the person on the committee, or should it just be the Ex Officio.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed there are interests and states roll call for that section.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Requested what the process is for all other board members to chime in.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated it's not too long ago.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: If there were no concerns to proceed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Regarding the Vision Zero plan, asked to bring that back, if possible and believes she may need to reappoint someone to that committee.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Regarding Waste diversion in August and the Legislative Review in September, asked are there any other presentation or items that have been scheduled or considered for future meetings.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed that I believe there have not been any scheduled at this point.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Commented I have been asking about the effectiveness of the cooling centers and heat resistance and would like whomever that is, to come to a meeting and let us know, and would like to know if they have enough people are utilizing them is there something resources they have or don't have or you know something that we can make recommendations on.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated to try and aim to be at the June July commission meeting to try and stay on track with all of those.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed, and indicated June would be even better because she wants to stay ahead of the inevitable heat wave.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned it's a question of reaching out to the other departments.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated yeah, and said people just want more transparency and what to do.

agenda_items.title: Reports and Information 6.B. Sustainability Office Updates: Earth Day 2025 and Climate Action Adaptation Plan
agenda_items.summary: Staff will provide an update on the Earth Day 2025 events and the Climate Action Adaptation Plan

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned that staff will walk everyone through everything that has been done since February since its been a while.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated in March, there was a clothing and art supply swap, as well as a repair cafe, the following week. This clothing swap and art supply swap was the biggest one to date. 120 people came by for a two hour event and about 590 pounds of clothing was collected and 490 was swapped.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Commented that 16 boxes of art supplies was collected and 16 pounds of batteries were recycled.  The repair cafe repaired about 56 items, including four bikes because they had bike repair people.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Requested who did bike repairs.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed it was someone who was available from the Pasadena Repair Cafe.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned that was great.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked if there were any press releases and publicity information online, and stated the turnout was fabulous.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed the amount of bikes that had been repaired.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated the Earth Day Fair was recently on April 26th. There was goat yoga and the city's first electric bus was unveiled, one of five supported from grant money coming soon. Food Cycle LA, Food Forward, Athens Services, Walk Bike Glendale,  Verdugo Woodlands, GEC, and Hoover High School Climate Club was also there and did an activity.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated part of his student project was to advocate for more students to show up to this event and make it more enticing for younger generations to get involved and was a potting station and seed bomb making station. About 40 seed bombs were made, along with a little pod decorating station for kids, so roughly 140 students were brought.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Commended everyone for their engagement.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Upcoming events are May 4th, a Verdugo 10K run, May 10th, the clothing swap, May 17th, the County is putting on a free tire recycling event for households at Lot 30 near Verdugo Park. May 24th the Office is holding a guided nature hike at Verdugo Trail with LA Works, going through Native plants, benefits, for the wildlife,  May 31st lets go Glendale open Street event, Community Development Department is hosting that event, June 7th is a coming back with the clothing swaps, June 14th is Repair Cafe.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated I'm curious as well, but wants to know if the actual revealings of buses in the solar panel is scheduled.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated the city owned solar with Perkins has been unveiled, because of concerns of people coming out to the roof, it was live streamed. For the buses, there was a time crunch, so they unveiled during Earth Day fair and invited people to walk into the bus.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired when the buses will be used.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated to not be sure, but I know it's pretty soon.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Requested if there was a way for, like, the first bus ride, that would be really cool to have everyone out for that.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated to definitely follow up and see if we can capture that on video or live stream that.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked if there is a limit on the tire recycling.  Affirmed the information.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed that all the information is located on .gov/community. Confirmed that the community and event page can be located on the .gov website. Affirmed and said it's all great.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed that she does not see any limits on the tires and they will be accepted including rims.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated the climate action adaptation plan is available for public review.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: A notice has been issued and the negative declaration for the initial study and that comment. Period has been extended through May 19th of 2025.  So those that interested people are urged to go to City of Glendale CAP. That document will be available for review and there are links about how to send comments directly to me.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Added staff hope to have the climate action adaptation plan adopted by the City Council this summer. The work has been done, it's been finalized, and everything so really excited. Stated we hope it all gets adopted.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed that by going to this website you will see the actual climate action plan and all the appendices, vulnerability assessment, Technical Analysis, so all the information is available for public review at this time.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired if there's an update about that?  Stated she knows for a while that link wasn't working, even as recently as two days ago and said it was glad it has been working now.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired is this isn't actually a negative declaration though this is a draft plan, or is the negative declaration attached to that.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed that you'll find the negative declaration at that address.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned that it wasn't labeled as negative declaration, just initial study, and it was very confusing and should be labeled what it is, because if the public doesn't know then how are they supposed to make comments, should say 'negative declaration for public comment' or it also sends them to all the other information that isn't needed. It is a lot to ask of the public.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed and inquired to to the actual website where these problems existed.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed to the .Ringcon website and agreed it to be a different website than what has been shown from the slides previously.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated on those sites the information should be better categorized and labeled what people are supposed to be commenting on.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: It is hard for those that are just starting to click on everything. It just needs to better help for people find the correct information and links and all that kind of thing.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: It made her think 'initial study' is the final draft/ negative declaration.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Requested a better setup and labeling of that website for public review to properly comment.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated and affirmed he would agree with that assessment, which is why the initial link was the environmental one. So we recently updated it but it only got done today as yesterday it hadn't been fixed yet.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Highlighted to take note that they have lost a couple of weeks, and for a quick fix. Inquired should the date be pushed out.

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned that Staff would communicate out the linking the correction, but not need to extend.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: Hoped there would be lots of comments, since it was such an important project.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Asked is the there any comments, has there been any comments?

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: There has only been one comment made so far.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated so and inquired should we legally take all actions to take note of that, since the public couldn't access the comment date?

commissioner_comments.speaker: City Legal Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Stated she needs to take a look at what you're referencing. That is what staff need to make sure, the documents are available there, and it make sure that nothing impeeds the ability to find a document and review, and get that within the 30 day period. It could get extended. We want to make sure that the public has the adequate time.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
commissioner_comments.comment: There has been a little disruption as there has been no community meetings and all commission events and all the reboot is over, said we should air on the side, of making sure there is opportunity available.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Councillor
commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned it's very important that they are not active and something people needed to be pointed to.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Councillor
commissioner_comments.comment: Apologized for the inconvenience.

oral_communications.speaker: Alan Dish
oral_communications.comment: Spoke in relation to the prom king as well as the loss of Trees. Asked to impose a stronger measure like declaring a state of emergency so can be implemented with some executive orders to put ban for cutting trees. The mayor gave a reply that was intelligent but could not do it because of the charter.
